item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Friday, November 22, 2024 at 3:15 PM UTC
item.description:
1. Show HN: A Marble Madness-inspired WebGL game we built for Netlify (110 points | 58 comments)
2. What Made Dostoevsky's Work Immortal (7 points | discuss)
3. Show HN: Rebels in the sky – Terminal game about space pirates (35 points | 16 comments)
4. FaSTer: Atari ST Digital Magazine (30 points | 5 comments)
5. Salmon return to lay eggs in historic habitat after dam removal project (66 points | 46 comments)
6. Key Transparency and the Right to Be Forgotten (25 points | 8 comments)
7. From string to AST: parsing (37 points | 8 comments)
8. A “meta-optics” camera that is the size of a grain of salt (120 points | 75 comments)
9. Prince Nico Mbarga’s biggest hit outsold any of The Beatles’ (13 points | 11 comments)
10. Show HN: Llama 3.2 Interpretability with Sparse Autoencoders (460 points | 64 comments)
11. Fern Is Hiring Software Engineers in Brooklyn ( | hide)
12. Handling cookies is a minefield (462 points | 218 comments)
13. A C++ Mixin System (25 points | 9 comments)
14. Do Large Language Models learn world models or just surface statistics? (2023) (21 points | 8 comments)
15. Autoflow, a Graph RAG based and conversational knowledge base tool (158 points | 19 comments)
16. NeuralDEM – Real-Time Simulation of Industrial Particulate Flows (35 points | 6 comments)
17. TIL: Some surprising code execution sources in bash (15 points | discuss)
18. Show HN: OnePageGA – Simple dashboard for GA4 like Plausible (11 points | 8 comments)
19. Bayesian Neural Networks (190 points | 32 comments)
20. OK, I can partly explain the LLM chess weirdness now (291 points | 243 comments)
21. What's Next for WebGPU (122 points | 130 comments)
22. The FORTH code for Chipwits is released in the game's 40th anniversary (196 points | 51 comments)
23. The meme-ification of the “Demon Core” (330 points | 243 comments)
24. Mechanically strong yet metabolizable plastic breaks down in seawater (76 points | 31 comments)
25. Growing Music: musical interpretations of L-Systems (2023) [pdf] (25 points | 4 comments)
26. Machiavelli and the Emergence of the Private Study (69 points | 14 comments)
27. WhisperNER: Unified Open Named Entity and Speech Recognition (94 points | 10 comments)
28. Fun with Logitech MX900 Bluetooth receivers (2006) (29 points | 16 comments)
29. Hyrum’s Law in Golang (295 points | 176 comments)
30. Interactive Visual Sorting (112 points | 22 comments)
